column4: just curious.. what does Applications > Accessories > Text Editor point to?  Is it nano?
how about Applications > Multimedia > Music Player (hopefully xmms?)
xmms ?
xmms is a nifty sound player.. I like it
its way old....
xmms i mean
oic
what does ubuntu give me?
rhythmbox
thanks
for mp3 playback see also this: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/RestrictedFormats
I think I'll get xmms.. I like its interface since I'm so used to WinAmp
then better take beep-media-player its the successor
wine is there, not by default though
ahh, didn't see it in the cd package list.
oh, i'm not sure if its on the cd

Doesn't seem like it.  I know it'd be in Debian's archive.  I'm still curious, can I download a DEB file and have it be installed by synaptic so that it knows about it, can be upgraded, uninstalled, etc?
nope... the dependencys could break....99% of debian packages are in universe/multiverse
I don't quite understand.  If I install universe/multiverse packages I could break the system dependencies?
nope, but if you install debian packages :)
oic.. is there any option for someone like me with a slow connection to download the universe/multiverse packages I need elsewhere and then install them later on my machine?
there was a thread on the mailing list....
